title: Human trafficking on the rise Sri Lanka sees 60% surge in cases in 2024, Report reveals
byline: The 2024 Trafficking in Persons Report conducted by the US Department of State disclosed a significant increase in trafficking cases in Sri Lanka, rising from 59 cases in 2023 to 95 cases in 2024.

title: 35 MPs seek housing facilities at Madiwela complex
byline: Thirty-five new MPs have asked for housing facilities at the Madiwela Housing Complex, according to an informed source.

title: 150 mm rain today
byline: Heavy showers or thundershowers of about 150 mm will be experienced  today in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern and Uva Provinces the Meteorology Department said.

title: Jeep plunges into stream: Two brothers killed
byline: Two bothers were killed after their jeep plunged into the Bujgamuwa stream at the Kamburapola bridge on the Kuliyapitiya-Hettipola Road early this morning.

title: Discrepancies in issuance of permits to expatriate workers to import electric vehicles
byline: There have been abuses in the issuance of permits for expatriate workers to import electric vehicles, according to an audit report.

title: Quandary over nomination papers for LG polls due to changes in political affiliations
byline: There is a quandary over nomination papers submitted for the local authorities’ election because of changes in political affiliations among candidates but the Election Commission has no choice but to proceed with the conduct of polls early next year, an official said.

title: Chewing betel and spitting, Badulla Municipality to book bus drivers, conductors, passengers
byline: Badulla Municipal Council’s health department has decided to take legal action against individuals spitting in public places after a chew of betel or smearing chunam in quid of betel on walls in public buildings.

title: Only 3% of SL’s workforce pursue entrepreneurship, says NEDA
byline: The National Enterprise Development Authority (NEDA) recently shared that Sri Lanka has a drastically low entrepreneurial interest among its citizens as only 3 percent of the current working population are engaged in entrepreneurship.

title: Market experiences limited activity and trades
byline: The secondary market yield curve remained relatively fixed and broadly unchanged amidst a notable lack of activity in the market yesterday.

title: Only invigilators allowed to use mobile phones during A/L exams this time
byline: Only the invigilators will be allowed to use mobile phones in the examination centers during the 2024 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examinations which is scheduled to begin on Monday (25).

title: Mahinda Deshapriya’s house in Ambalangoda robbed
byline: Former Election Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya’s residence in Ambalangoda was robbed, and items valued at approximately Rs. 300,000 stolen, police said.

title: Low-pressure area over Bay of Bengal intensifying into depression tomorrow
byline: The low-pressure area  formed over the southeast Bay of Bengal is likely to move west north-westwards and intensify into a depression tomorrow, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Local Government polls to be held early next year: Vijitha
byline: The Local Government elections will be held at the beginning of next year, said Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath.

title: Another student injured in Badulla KDU bus accident dies
byline: Another student who was receiving treatment at the hospital after a bus carrying students of the Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU) overturned on November 1 has died today, police said.

title: Health officials warn of spreading viral fever
byline:
Health officials have issued a warning on the spread of a viral fever in the community.

Common symptoms include fever, chills, sore throat and cough.

They urge individuals to seek prompt medical attention if these symptoms last for longer than three days.
